title: Admetella
text:
Admetella is a genus of marine <a href="annelid">annelid</a>s in the family <a href="Polynoidae">Polynoidae</a> (scale worms). Species of "Admetella", although uncommonly collected are nevertheless known from widespread localities in the <a href="Indian%20Ocean">Indian</a>, <a href="Pacific">Pacific</a> and <a href="Atlantic%20Oceans">Atlantic Oceans</a> at depths of 400–6,000 m.
Description.
Species of "Admetella" have a short triangular sheath-like appendage at the base of the <a href="Prostomium">lateral antennae</a> and have 50 or more segments and 25 to 31 pairs of <a href="elytron%20%28Annelida%29">elytra</a>. <a href="Chaeta">Notochaetae</a> and <a href="Chaeta">neurochaetae</a> are long, slender and are distally flattened.
Species.
Three valid species of "Admetella" are known as of July 2020:
